node.title: ‘Writing With Fire’ Review: Speaking Truth to Power
node.description: This rousing documentary follows the reporters of India’s only all-women news outlet as they pivot to digital journalism while battling personal and political challenges.

node.title: Explosion Outside School Kills 8 in Somalia’s Capital

node.title: Are Stores Open on Thanksgiving 2021? Opening Hours for Walmart, CVS, Costco and More

node.description: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration and CDC has given all adults the green light to get a booster shot.

node.title: The Car Key of the Future (Is Still in Your Pocket)

node.title: Rivian’s Electric Truck Is a Cutie and a Beast

node.title: Egypt to reopen ancient parade route, the "Avenue of Sphinxes"
node.description: The 1.7-mile-long "Path of God," lined with more than 1,000 sphinx and ram statues, spent centuries buried by the sands of time. But it's about to come back - with all due pomp and ceremony.

node.title: Are the Knicks and Lakers Really Worth $5 Billion?
node.description: Sports franchise valuations are guesses, with few data points for comparison. But prestige franchises like these can defy all calculations.

node.title: Is the Post Office Open on Thanksgiving Day? Hours and Delivery Information Revealed
node.description: Many government offices and some private businesses are closed on Thanksgiving. But is the U.S. Postal Service (USPS) open on the day?

node.title: Internet Backs Woman Refusing to Clean up As Men Watch Thanksgiving Football
node.description: A woman who is sick of doing the Thanksgiving cleanup while men watch football has announced a boycott online—and attracted widespread support.

node.title: Rescuers suspend search after deadly Russian mine fire, with dozens still trapped underground
node.description: Coal dust catches fire in a ventilation shaft at the Listvyazhnaya mine in the snowbound Kemerovo region, filling the underground workplace with smoke, according to authorities.

node.title: Seven accused drug traffickers arrested in Adelaide's south
node.description: Police have seized kilograms of illicit drugs, cash and drug paraphernalia allegedly linked to a southern suburbs drug syndicate.

node.title: Mothers get bail, men remain in custody after group allegedly uses back roads to breach WA border
node.description: Two children are among the group that allegedly crossed into WA from the NT earlier this month in the midst of an COVID-19 outbreak there. The adult men are remanded in custody in Kalgoorlie.

node.title: Solomon Islands unrest jolts Australia's 'Pacific Step-up'

node.title: Astronomers Find Hundreds of New Worlds, Including Unusually Close Saturn-Sized Gas Giants
node.description: The 366 exoplanets were found by an algorithm that searched 800 million images of stars taken by NASA's Kepler Space Telescope in its K2 mission.

node.title: Why Talking Politics at Thanksgiving Might Be a Good Idea
node.description: Many families will hope to avoid talking about politics as they gather together. But while it might feel uncomfortable to debate, it could help heal divisions.

node.title: The History of Thanksgiving: Here's How the American Tradition Began
node.description: The origins of Thanksgiving can be traced back to harvest festivals, when the Pilgrims and Native Americans gave thanks for a bountiful harvest.

node.title: Tired of the East Coast, They Followed Their Hearts to Los Angeles. But Where Would They End Up Living?
node.description: Intent on giving themselves ‘the best shot at being happy with California,’ a young couple tested the rental market, where their money would go further. Here’s what they found.

node.title: The Rise of Psychedelic Retreats

node.title: Charter schools use govt funding to pay $450k to owners before joining state school system

node.title: Watch: Dr Shane Reti speaks as National's new interim leader
node.description: Judith Collins was forced to step down after her caucus issued a motion of no confidence in her, interim leader Dr Shane Reti has confirmed. Watch his first press conference as leader here.

node.title: Marlborough District Council subsidises local airline fares

node.title: 'Corporate welfare': Push back over proposals that would reduce emissions by 1pc

node.title: 'Hello, conspiracy theorists. Please, get a life': NT chief's big swipe at 'international trolls' spreading COVID-19 misinformation
node.description: The Northern Territory Chief Minister has delivered a spray against "tinfoil hat-wearing tossers sitting in their parent's basement" who he says are spreading conspiracy theories about the Territory's current COVID-19 outbreak.

node.description: Prime Minister Scott Morrison says Australian troops and police will be sent to Solomon Islands to help stabilise the island nation amid growing violence and unrest.

node.title: The Penknife: A Thanksgiving Memory

node.title: Usman Khawaja's captaincy may cost him an Ashes spot after Travis Head tons up

node.title: AFL draft continues with clubs ready to pounce on bargains — join the discussion

node.title: The Melbourne man who took on the Catholic Church over historical sexual abuse and won

node.title: Energy Minister Dan van Holst Pellekaan unveiled as SA's new Deputy Premier
node.description: Dan van Holst Pellekaan is officially South Australia's new Deputy Premier, after a vote of Lower House Liberal MPs this afternoon.

node.title: Australian farmers just as productive with borders closed, study finds

node.title: Russian military warns debris from one of its rockets could fall into Tasmanian waters

node.title: Collins may be gone but NZ's search for a credible, viable opposition is not over

node.title: New Swedish PM resigns on first day in job
node.description: Social Democrat Magdalena Andersson resigned after less than 12 hours in the top job after the Green Party quit their two-party coalition, stoking political uncertainty.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 178 new community cases today, one more death
node.description: The Ministry of Health is also reporting that there are 77 people in hospital, including eight people in ICU.

node.title: Scattered, Broke Defendants Make Collecting $26M 'Unite The Right' Settlement Difficult

node.title: Vaccination Proof Required For Visitors, Not Lawmakers, in New Mexico's Capitol Building
node.description: Vaccinated individuals would be able to go to legislative hearings starting in January, a first since the pandemic started.

node.title: Gunshots allegedly fired in remote NT community
node.description: Police are responding to reports of serious unrest and gunshots being fired in the community of Peppimenarti, south-west of Darwin, which has been struggling with reports of violence for months.

node.description: Yesterday's rise in the official cash rate is being described as a kick in the guts for first home buyers.

node.title: 'Kiwis deserve more' - probe finds power cuts on freezing night unnecessary

node.title: A New Hall of Fame Ballot Is a Chance to Remember
node.description: A great deal of ink will be spilled on the candidacies of Alex Rodriguez and David Ortiz. For a moment, stop to consider the 11 other new candidates instead.

node.title: Peng Shuai’s Accusation Pierced the Privileged Citadel of Chinese Politics
node.description: Zhang Gaoli was best known as a low-key technocrat. Then a Chinese tennis star’s allegations made him a symbol of a system that bristles against scrutiny.

node.title: Melbourne's COVID-19 lockdowns saw stillbirths rise
node.description: A new study finds the rate of stillbirth in Melbourne during the lockdown period increased from one in 400 births to one in 300.

node.title: SA records three new cases of COVID-19, three Qantas flights listed as exposure sites
node.description: South Australia records three new cases of COVID-19, with three flights now listed as exposure locations.

node.title: Talks Between Kellogg's And Striking Workers Will Resume Next Week Despite Company's Threat
node.description: One of the key issues in negotiations is the two-tiered wage system Kellogg's uses, with about 30 percent of the 1,400 striking workers at the lower level.

node.title: New Lawsuits Filed Against Rapper Travis Scott Following Deaths at Astroworld Concert
node.description: The lawsuits, not unlike others, blames Scott and the companies who ran the concert, for the failure of having basic safety precautions.

node.title: Meet Gordon, the loyal cat who ratted out a tiger snake
node.description: A Dartmoor man urges residents in southern Victoria and South Australia to be vigilant after his cat found a deadly snake hiding among shopping bags in his kitchen.

node.title: Woman who pretended to be volunteer firefighter for Black Summer disaster payments jailed

node.title: Masks off but QR codes to stay as NSW COVID-19 restrictions tweaked
node.description: The NSW government updates the roadmap for easing COVID-19 restrictions after the state reaches the 95 per cent double-dose vaccination target or December 15, whichever comes first.
